summary: This bill, the "Long Island Sound Restoration and Stewardship Reauthorization Act of 2025," proposes to extend federal funding for two key programs aimed at protecting the Long Island Sound. It amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act and the Long Island Sound Stewardship Act of 2006 to reauthorize grants for restoration and stewardship activities for the fiscal years 2025 through 2029. Introduced by a bipartisan pair of representatives, the act ensures the continuation of federal support for projects that improve water quality and restore the habitat of this significant estuary.
